intro: Brookea albicans, commonly known as the white brookea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a subtle fragrance. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a lush green backdrop to its showy blooms. Brookea albicans is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively easy care requirements.
